subject: Relationships
title: Trust Across Cultures
description: A quick, practical guide to Trust Across Cultures.

hook.text: In Scandinavia, 65% of people trust strangers. In Brazil, it's 7%. Culture programs your trust default setting.

buildup.text: The World Values Survey measures interpersonal trust globally. Nordic countries consistently rank highest.

discovery.text: High-trust societies have lower corruption, stronger economies, and better public health outcomes.

twist.text: Trust isn't just a personality trait. It's infrastructure. Low-trust societies pay a 'trust tax' on every transaction.

climax.text: Trust is a society's invisible currency. Countries rich in trust prosper. Countries poor in it struggle.

punchline.text: Trust is invisible infrastructure. Societies rich in it prosper.

quiz.question: What percentage of Scandinavians trust strangers?
